description: The alias for the jQuery function, which is used to create a jQuery object that wraps one or more DOM elements.

name: DOM
description: The Document Object Model, which represents the HTML structure of a web page as a hierarchical tree of nodes, each of which can be manipulated with JavaScript.

name: Selector
description: A string or function that specifies a set of elements to be selected from the DOM, using CSS syntax or other methods.

name: Method Chaining
description: A programming pattern in which multiple methods are called on the same object in a single statement, allowing for more concise and readable code.

name: Event
description: An action that occurs in response to user interaction or other triggers, such as clicking a button or scrolling the page.

name: Callback
description: A function that is passed as an argument to another function and is called when a certain event or condition occurs, allowing for asynchronous and event-driven programming.

name: Ajax
description: Asynchronous JavaScript and XML, a set of web technologies that allows for data to be retrieved from a server without refreshing the entire web page.

name: JSON
description: JavaScript Object Notation, a lightweight data format that is easy for humans to read and write, and easy for machines to parse and generate.

name: Animation
description: The process of changing the appearance or position of an element over time, often used to create visual effects or improve user experience.

name: Plugin
description: An extension or module that adds new functionality to jQuery, often created by third-party developers and shared through the jQuery Plugin Registry.

name: Deferred
description: An object that represents a value that may not be available yet, and allows you to attach callback functions that will be called when the value is resolved or rejected.

name: Promise
description: An object that represents a value that may not be available yet, but will be resolved with a value or rejected with an error at some point in the future.
